activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R Nerling

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:36 PM Defendant Matthew R Nerling appeared by video in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant must call the public defender's office today to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.  Court may appoint Attorney Sutton if defendant does not qualify for Public Defender services.

(MS scanned to jail)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is served or sold on the premises.
Defendant must have no contact with R.N.

1:06 PM Defendant Matthew R Nerling appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alex Kitto (for today) appeared by video for Matthew R Nerling.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

1:06  Court relates and gives appearances.
1:06  State relates.
1:10  Atty. Kitto and defendant go into break-out room; 1:12 Return from break-out room.
AIA set; must appear in person with counsel.

Laura Sutton is appointed in this case; JA to contact Laura Sutton as soon as possible.

(Bond and MS scanned to jail)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Letter from David Nerling to Judge Bitney
